meanings.definition: To cause to contract or shrink
meanings.sent1: After applying the astringing solution, the fabric shrank in size.
meanings.sent2: She was astringing the rope tightly around the package to secure it.
meanings.sent3: The astringing effect of the cold water made the pool seem smaller than usual.
meanings.sent4: The astringing force of the vacuum cleaner sucked in all the dirt from the carpet.
meanings.sent5: The astringing power of the magnet pulled the metal pieces closer together.

meanings.sent1: The chef was astringing the dough to form perfect little balls for baking.
meanings.sent2: He was astringing his backpack to fit all his camping gear inside.
meanings.sent3: The astringing action of the vacuum cleaner compressed the dust into a small bag.
meanings.sent4: Her words had an astringing effect on his heart, making it feel heavy and tight.
meanings.sent5: The astringing grip of the monkey's hand held onto the branch securely.

meanings.sent1: The snake's muscles were astringing around its prey, preparing to strike.
meanings.sent2: The cold weather was astringing the branches of the tree, making them bend.
meanings.sent3: The astringing effect of the rubber band made it snap back and hit his finger.
meanings.sent4: The astringing feeling in her chest tightened as she approached the stage to speak.
meanings.sent5: The astringing force of the wind drew the curtains together, blocking out the sunlight.
